response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: Asyncio Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer delves into the enhancements and updates of the asyncio standard library module in Python 3.12+, highlighting key features, code examples, version notes, and caveats.
key_points: Enhanced error handling with new exception types
Task group functionality for managing tasks efficiently

code_examples.code:
async def example():
    task = asyncio.create_task(some_coroutine())
    await task
    print('Task completed')

async def some_coroutine():
    # Your coroutine implementation goes here.

version_notes: Windows event loops are available in asyncio for the first time with Python 3.12.
The selectors API has been optimized to improve performance.
New exception types, such as TimeoutError and CancelledError, have been added for improved error handling.
caveats: While task group functionality simplifies managing tasks, it can lead to complex dependency structures if not used judiciously.
The enhancements in asyncio may not have a significant impact on simple use cases but will greatly benefit performance-critical applications.
